arguments.description: commandline of a python program to run
arguments.name: python_program

description: Records stack trace information to a flamegraph, speedscope or raw file

options.description: PID of a running python program to spy on
options.name: --pid

options.description: Show full Python filenames, instead of shortening to show only the package part
options.name: --full-filenames

options.description: Output file format [default: flamegraph] [possible values: flamegraph, raw, speedscope, chrometrace]
options.name: --format

options.description: The number of seconds to sample for [default: unlimited]
options.name: --duration

options.description: The number of samples to collect per second [default: 100]
options.name: --rate

options.description: Profile subprocesses of the original process
options.name: --subprocesses

options.description: Aggregate samples by function's first line number, instead of current line number
options.name: --function

options.description: Show thread ids in the output
options.name: --threads

options.description: Only include traces that are holding on to the GIL
options.name: --gil

options.description: Include stack traces for idle threads
options.name: --idle

options.description: Collect stack traces from native extensions written in Cython, C or C++
options.name: --native

options.description: Don't pause the python process when collecting samples. Setting this option will reduce the performance impact of sampling, but may lead to inaccurate results
options.name: --nonblocking
